thread.title: Three local football stars get UGA offer
thread.title_full: Three local football stars get UGA offer

title: Three local football stars get UGA offer
text:
Three local football stars get UGA offer Park Crossing's Malik Cunningham and Marcus "Tank" Jenkins, and Sidney Lanier's Alfred Thomas get UGA offers Post to Facebook Three local football stars get UGA offer Park Crossing's Malik Cunningham and Marcus "Tank" Jenkins, and Sidney Lanier's Alfred Thomas get UGA offers Check out this story on montgomeryadvertiser.com: http://on.mgmadv.com/1LILQMB Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation Ethan Bernal , Montgomery Advertiser 12:56 p.m. CDT October 20, 2015 Buy Photo 
Park Crossing quarterback Malik Cunningham looks for a receiver. Park Crossing takes on Carver on Friday, Oct. 9, 2015, at Cramton Bowl in Montgomery. (Photo: Shannon Heupel/Advertiser) 
Park Crossing's quarterback Malik Cunningham and offensive lineman Marcus "Tank" Jenkins, and Sidney Lanier defensive lineman Alfred Thomas each earned offers from the Georgia Bulldogs on Tuesday morning. 
Cunningham, a 6-foot, 175-pound junior is averaging 184 passing yards per game with 20 touchdowns and nine interceptions. He's also run for 477 yards and 10 touchdowns. Cunningham now has offers from UGA, West Georgia and Georgia Southern. 
Jenkins, a 6-foot-4, 315-pound tackle is a 4-star star prospect and the No. 1 rated player in the state for the 2018 class by 247 Sports. He transferred to Park Crossing from Robert E. Lee in the offseason, and also has offers from Auburn, Florida, LSU and Florida State. 
Park Crossing coach Smitty Grider tweeted the news: Congrats Malik Cunningham and Tank Jenkins for picking up Georgia Offer. Keep working. Proud of you! ‚Äî Smitty Grider (@grider_s) October 20, 2015 
Thomas, a 6-foot-3, 255-pound 4-star is the No. 2 rated player in the state for the 2018 class by 247 Sports. He moved from defensive end to defensive tackle this season, and also has offers from Mississippi State and Kentucky. 
Lanier coach C.J. Harris shared the news on Twitter: Congratulations to Alfred Thomas @AlfredThomas05 just Picked up the Georgia Offerüèàüèàüèàüèàüê∂üê∂üê∂ pic.twitter.com/52c6aGxawd ‚Äî Coach CJ Harris (@CJtheCch) October 20, 2015 Read or Share this story: http://on.mgmadv.com/1LILQMB Most Popular
